title: Clustering
description: A computer cluster is a set of computers that work together so that they can be viewed as a single system.
key-ideas: Clustering is the grouping of systems that work together as a single entity to perform a service.
Can provide failover for clusters using redundant systems.
Performance: cluster additional computational resources to perform advanced and complicated computational tasks.
Load-balancing: distribute service requests among identical back end servers.
Availability: HA clusters provide multiple failover protections through redundant or replicated systems.
Open clusters have each node individually addressed and are individually accessible.
Closed clusters are accessed through a gateway that distributes requests to the clustered nodes.
